rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all ammunition. Ammunition is the projectile intended to be fired from an mso:military.gun.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ammunition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
An armed force is a top-level military force with no military chain of command outside of itself. It can be a military extension of a nation, group of nations, or a political, religious or ethnic group. Armed forces are usually made up of different mso:military.unit.
Things that are armed forces:
## Top-level military forces of a nation (e.g. Canadian Forces, Singapore Armed Forces, Australian Defense Force).
## Military forces of a group of nations (e.g. Joint Force Command Naples, European Gendarmerie Force, European Union Battlegroup).
## Political, religious and ethnic military groups (e.g. Liberation Tigers of Tamil, IRA, Izz Ad-din Al-Qassam Brigade, Shan State Army South).
## Branch of an armed force (e.g. U.S. Army, Canadian Forces Air Command, Royal Australian Navy, Aeronautica Militare).
## Reserve military forces (e.g. U.S. Navy Reserve, Territorial Army).
## Ancient armies that represented a nation or group of nations (e.g. ancient Macedonian military, Janissary, ancient Theban army).
Things that are NOT armed forces:
## Divisions, groupings, teams or units within an armed force (e.g. U.S. 77th Infantry Division, 4th Force Reconnaissance Company, U.S. 761st Tank Battalion, Mobile Assault Platoon). Use mso:military.unit in these cases.
## Field armies (e.g. British Eight Army). Use mso:military.unit for these.
## Elite members and special operations units of any armed force (e.g. United States Army Rangers, United States Navy Seals). Use mso:military.unit for these.
## Private military companies (PMC) (e.g. DynCorp International, Executive Outcomes, Sandline International). Use mso:business.operation for these.
## Law enforcement and police departments (e.g. New York City Police Department, London Police). Use mso:government.agency for these.
## Non-combat government organizations (e.g. FBI, CIA). Use mso:government.agency for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Armed Force

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an armed force to information about where and when the armed force has been posted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Posts

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:military.armed_force to the mso:military.service(s) that have occurred in this armed force.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Personnel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an armed force to another armed force when the first is a part of the second.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subdivision of

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an armed force to another armed force, when the second is a part of the first. Note that this property should not be used to relate an armed force to one of its units. In that case, the property mso:military.armed_force.units should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subdivisions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an armed force to one of its units, e.g. the British 3rd Infantry Division, the US's 506th Infantry Regiment, and the 2nd Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Units

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A medal or decoration, e.g. the Purple Heart and the Bronze Star, that are given to military personnel for acts of valor or service rendered.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Award

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the casualties suffered by a combatant in a military conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casualties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the combatant in the conflict about which casualty figures are provided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Combatant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the military conflict about which casualty figures are provided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the person or organization that provided the casualty figures.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Estimated by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the lower bound of the casualty estimate provided by the given source.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lower Estimate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that provides a standard descriptor for the type(s) of deaths and injuries incurred in the conflict, e.g. Civilian - Wounded, Military - Dead, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type Of Casualties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the upper bound of the casualty estimate provided by the given source.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Upper Estimate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for types of deaths and injuries incurred in military combat situations, e.g. Civilian - Wounded, Military - Dead, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casualties Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all military combatants, i.e. the agents engaging in a military conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Combatant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a combatant to the armed force of which the combatant is a member, e.g. the combatant's army, navy, air force, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Armed Force

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates two combatants, when the second is a group and the first is a part of the second. For example, the property relates Nazi Germany to the Axis Powers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Belongs to Combatant Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military combatant to information about the casualties in conflicts where the combatant has taken part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casualties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military combatant to information about the size of the forces of the combatant in conflicts where the combatant has taken part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Force Deployments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates two combatants, when the first is a group and the second is a part of the first. For example, the property relates the Axis Powers to Nazi Germany.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes Allies

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military combatant to information about who commanded the combatant in military conflicts.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Commanders

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a combatant to a military conflict in which the combatant has taken part. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to military.conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Conflicts
Military combatant group
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. Properties on military.combatant and military.conflict can be used to relate combatants and conflicts directly. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter all combatants who fought on the same side as multiple values in the same row. A combatant is a country or armed force; individuals should not be entered as combatants.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Combatants
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type military.combatant_group is not necessary. Properties on military.combatant and military.conflict can be used to relate combatants and conflicts directly. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The name of the conflict. The conflict can be as large as a war, or as small as an individual battle.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conflict
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type military.combatant_group is not necessary. Properties on military.combatant and military.conflict can be used to relate combatants and conflicts directly. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about who served as commander for the given military combatant in the given conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Command

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that specifies the military combatant for which the commander is provided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Combatant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the commander of the combatant in the given military conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Commander

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the battle or war for which information is provided.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing all military commanders. These are the people that command troops or military forces.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Commander

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military commander to information about the situations where the person has served as commander.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Commands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all military conflicts. These are violent events in which opposing sides engage in a clash.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military conflict to information about the casualties incurred in the conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casualties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military conflict to a combatant involved in the conflict. Note that the expected type of this property should eventually be changed to military.combatant.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Combatants

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military conflict to information about who commanded the combatants in the conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Commanders

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military conflict to information about the size and type of forces of the combatants in the conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Force Strengths

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: where it happened
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Locations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the size of the forces of a particular combatant in a given military conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Force Strength

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given military combatant.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Combatant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given battle or war.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date for which the force strength information is valid for the given combatant and conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of troops of the given combatant in the given military conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Force Size
Maximum Force Size
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear how this property differs in meaning from military.force_strength.force_size. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:military.force_strength.force_size]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the weapons of the given combatant in the given conflict.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Resource

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of guns, i.e. devices that fire projectiles at high velocity from a barrel. The projectiles may be artillery shells, bullets or harpoons, for example.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gun

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to a description of the mechanism by which ammunition is loaded, fired, and ejected by the gun.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Action

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:military.gun to the mso:military.ammunition the gun uses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ammunition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the length of the gun barrel in millimeters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Barrel Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun tothe measure in millimeters of the internal diameter of the barrel of the gun.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Caliber

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the maximum distance that a projectile can travel from the gun and still be reasonably certain of hitting its target.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Effective Firing Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the vertical angular distance that the gun can be rotated. Note that this property applies only to guns that have a fixed base, e.g. guns on naval ships.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Elevation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the number of rounds that a magazine or belt that is used to feed the gun is capable of holding. Note that this property is multivalued, because a gun may have more than one type of feed system associated with it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Feed System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the maximum distance that a projectile can travel when fired from the gun.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Firing Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the speed with which a projectile leaves the end of the gun when it is fired.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Muzzle Velocity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a gun to the number of barrels, i.e. the tubes through which projectiles are fired, that the gun contains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Barrels

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the maximum number of rounds that can be fired by the gun in the span of one minute.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rate of Fire

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the measure in millimeters of the distance that gun moves backward when it is fired.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recoil

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to a description of the sighting mechanism included with the gun.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sighting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a gun to the horizontal angular distance that the gun can be rotated. Note that this property applies only to guns that have a fixed base, e.g. guns on naval ships.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Traverse

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Primary entity representing the collection of all military persons. These are people who are or were members of the armed forces.
People that are military persons:
## Cadets and R.O.T.C. participants (e.g. flight cadet Robert M. White).
## Combat Commanders (regional military leaders, formerly known as Commanders-in-Chief) (e.g. James O. Ellis of the US Strategic Command, Vittorio Emanuele of the Italian Cavalry).
## Retired and current military persons (e.g. Colin Powell, David Petraeus).
## Persons in an armed force not representing a country (e.g. members of the Provisional Irish Republican Army).
## Reservists (e.g. Joe Wilson).
People that are NOT military persons:
## Government officials with ties to foreign affairs (e.g. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, Kofi Annan).
## Profession or noble titles (e.g. President of the United States, Prince of Wales).
## Groups of military people (e.g. McMahon and Judge). Each person in the group should be typed with mso:military.person.
## People with honorary military titles (e.g. Colonel Sanders honorary Kentucky Colonel and Craig Ferguson honorary Nebraska Admiral).
## Members of non-military "armies" (e.g. Salvation Army).
## Civilian Commanders-in-Chief (e.g. Barack Obama).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Person

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soldier to the country which the soldier is defending or on behalf of which he is fighting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Allegiance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soldier to a military award earned by the soldier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Awards

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soldier to a war or battle where the soldier was deployed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a soldier to information about the military posts where the soldier served and when he or she served there.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Postings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a soldier to information about the rank, units, and armed service of the soldier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all military posts, i.e. the military installations where troops are stationed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Post

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military post to information about the people who served and when they served at the post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: People Posted Here

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military post to information about which armed forces used the post and when.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used by Armed Forces

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which armed force used a particular military post in a given time frame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Post Use

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the armed force that used the given military post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Armed Force

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the beginning of the time frame when the military post was used by the armed force.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the military post that was used by the given armed force.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Post

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the end of the time frame when the military post was used by the armed force.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about when a soldier was assigned to a particular military post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Posting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date when the soldier was first assigned to the military post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the solider who was assigned to the given military post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Person

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the military post to which the given soldier was assigned.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Post

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date when the soldier was last assigned to the military post.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all military ranks, i.e. the formal positions of private, air marshal, general, etc. within the hierarchy of a military organization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a military rank to another military rank (in another system) that is equivalent to it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Equivalent Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a military rank to the code used by members of the NATO alliance to identify the rank.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: NATO Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military rank to the next higher rank in a hierarchy of military ranks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next Higher Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military rank to the next lower rank in a hierarchy of military ranks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next Lower Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a military rank to a code used outside of the NATO alliance to identify the rank.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Non-NATO Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a military rank to the number of stars, one through six, corresponding to the military rank.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an military.rank to information about people who had the rank in the armed services.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used by Services
Military Resource
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this type overlaps with both military.weapon and military.unit_size. One of these two types should be used instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the military service of a soldier, the armed force of which he or she was a member, the assigned unit, the rank, and the time frame that the rank was held by the soldier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the armed force that the given person served in. This property is, strictly speaking, redundant with the military.service.unit property (since units are linked to their armed forces). However, many sources list only a person's armed force and not the unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Armed Force

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the soldier attained the given rank.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the given soldier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Person

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:military.service to the mso:military.rank the person held during this service.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date on which the soldier stopped serving at this rank, either because he or she was discharged or because he or she was promoted or demoted.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the military unit to which the soldier belonged (e.g. a regiment, division, brigade, etc.). The value for this property should be the most granular unit known. For example, if someone served in the US 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment, that should be used rather than the 101st Airborne Division (to which the 506th is attached). However, if all that is known is that the soldier served in the 101st, then that should be the value of the property.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Unit
Military Theater
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not used, and its intended meaning is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A military unit is a homogenous military organization (either combat, combat-support or non-combat in capability) that includes service personnel predominantly from a single arm of service, or a branch of service, and its administrative and command functions are self-contained. Examples of military units include the British 3rd Infantry Division, the US's 506th Infantry Regiment, and the 2 Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group. Common terms for military units include (but are not limited to) division, battalion, brigade, regiment, unit, fleet, wing, squadron, company, and field army. This type includes specific named military units, rather than general types of military units.
Things that are military units:
## Division (e.g. US 2nd Infantry Division).
## Company (e.g. Norwegian Independent Company 1).
## Battalion (e.g. 43rd Battalion Virginia Cavalry).
## Field Army (e.g. British Eighth Army).
## Teams within a militia (e.g. Green Mountain Boys).
## Platoon (e.g. Pathfinder Platoon).
Things that are NOT military units:
## Top level of a political, religious, or ethnic group (e.g. Michigan Militia). Use mso:military.armed_force in these cases.
## Non-combat government organizations (e.g. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, CIA, FBI). Use mso:government.agency in these cases.
## A type of military unit (e.g. Brigade). Use mso:military.unit_size in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military unit to the armed force of which it is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Armed Force

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating an instance of mso:military.unit to a weapon that the unit typically has as a resource.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Equipment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military unit to the date when the unit came into existence.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Formed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a mso:military.unit to the song or march that plays officially or commonly when the unit ceremonially marches.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: March

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military unit to the location where it began.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an instance of mso:military.unit to the typical strategic or tactical role for the unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a military unit to information about the soldiers who served in the unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Service Members
Military unit place of origin
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. Use location.location instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\jcoop] Successor:[mso:location.location]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: military_units
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The primary entity representing military unit types, i.e. the general designations for instances of mso:military.unit. Examples of military units sizes: platoon, company, mechanized infantry, cavalry, and so forth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Unit Size

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a unit size designation to the symbol in NATO's APP-6A classification system to represent units of this size.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: APP-6A Symbol

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a unit size designation to the typical rank of a soldier that commands such a unit size.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Commanded by Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military unit size designation to a military unit that has this designation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a military unit size designation to the range of personnel that are typically assigned to this type of unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Personnel Strength

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The primary entity representing all military unit types. Military unit types are the general designations for instances of mso:military.unit. Examples of military units types: platoon, company, mechanized infantry, cavalry, and so forth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type appears to have the same meaning as military.unit_size. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:military.unit_size]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of weapons, i.e. devices created to fight, injure, kill or hunt.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weapon

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon to a military conflict in which the weapon was used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conflict

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon to the number of people required to operate the weapon.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crew

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon to the date/time that the weapon was first used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Used

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An event in which a single weapon or a series of weapons are tested.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weapon Test

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon test to a number indicating how many subtests are part of the overarching test.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Subtests

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon test to a descriptor for the test, e.g. underground.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Test Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon test to the amount of energy released by the test expressed as kilotons of TNT.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TNT Equivalent

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a weapon test to a weapon that was tested.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weapon
